snippet: Portugal’s prime minister warned on Sunday that additional spending cuts were needed after a court struck down some austerity measures agreed to for a bailout two years ago.
abstract: Portuguese Prime Min Pedro Passos Coelho warns of economic danger following court ruling that strikes down several austerity measures; decision will leave government short about 1.4 billion euros; analysts worry that turmoil could spread to other euro zone nations already jittery due to banking crisis in Cyprus.
lead_paragraph: Portugal’s prime minister warned on Sunday that additional spending cuts were needed after a court struck down some austerity measures agreed to for a bailout two years ago.

headline.seo: Portuguese Debt Crisis Brings New Trouble for Euro
headline.main: New Trouble for Euro in Portugal
headline.print_headline: New Trouble For Euro In Portugal
